alert.note: Alert for Chiriaco Summit; Chuckwalla Valley; Joshua Tree NP East; Palo Verde Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued April 11 at 12:58PM PDT until April 12 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 AM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...West winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph expected. * WHERE...Eastern portion of Joshua Tree National Park, Chiriaco Summit, Palo Verde Valley and Chuckwalla Valley. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 8 AM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.

area.areaDesc: Chiriaco Summit; Chuckwalla Valley; Joshua Tree NP East; Palo Verde Valley
